newsitem.title: USA: Lightering done on capsized barge on Mississippi.
newsitem.headline: Lightering done on capsized barge on Mississippi.

text.p: Crews completed lightering a volatile cargo of benzene and gasoline from a capsized barge in the Mississippi River Monday night, but marine traffic in the area is still restricted, the Coast Guard reported Tuesday morning.

A crane from Vicksburg, Miss., is expected to arrive about noon Tuesday to begin the day-long process of rigging the barge to right it on Thursday or Friday, Coast Guard spokesman Chris Haley told Reuters.

The barge capsized March 17 after a tow of 25 barges hit a bridge in the fast-moving, flood-swollen river currents. Several other incidents on the river prompted the Coast Guard to issue restrictions on marine traffic, including a one-way, one-vessel or tow at a time limit in the area of the accident.
